member.summary:

How you want to obtain payment: Authorization indicates that this payment is a basic authorization subject to
settlement with PayPal Authorization and Capture. Sale indicates that this is a final sale for which you are requesting payment.

member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Total of order, including shipping, handling, and tax. Limitations: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Request.SOFTDESCRIPTOR
member.summary:
Required: No.
The soft descriptor is a per transaction description of the payment that is passed to the consumer’s credit card statement.
If a value for the soft descriptor field is provided, the full descriptor displayed on the customer’s statement has the following format:
[PP * | PAYPAL *][Merchant descriptor as set in the Payment Receiving Preferences][1 space][soft descriptor] The soft descriptor can contain only the following characters:
Alphanumeric characters - (dash) * (asterisk) . (period) {space} If you use any other characters (such as “,”), an error code is returned.
The soft descriptor does not include the phone number, which can be toggled between the merchant’s customer service number and PayPal’s customer service number.
The maximum length of the total soft descriptor is 22 characters. Of this, either 4 or 8 characters are used by the PayPal prefix shown in the data format.
Thus, the maximum length of the soft descriptor passed in the API request is: 22 - len([PP * | PAYPAL *]) - len([Descriptor set in Payment Receiving Preferences] + 1)
For example, assume the following conditions: The PayPal prefix toggle is set to PAYPAL * in PayPal’s admin tools.
The merchant descriptor set in the Payment Receiving Preferences is set to EBAY. The soft descriptor is passed in as JanesFlowerGifts LLC.
The resulting descriptor string on the credit card would be: PAYPAL *EBAY JanesFlow

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Request.IPADDRESS
member.summary:
Required: No.
IP address of the payer’s browser. IMPORTANT: PayPal records this IP addresses as a means to detect possible fraud.
Character length and limitations: 15 single-byte characters, including periods, for example: 255.255.255.255.
Allowable values: any valid Internet Protocol address.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Request.CREDITCARDTYPE
member.summary:
Required: No.
Type of credit card. Character length and limitations: Up to ten single-byte alphabetic characters.
Allowable values: Visa, MasterCard, Discover, Amex, Switch, or Solo. IMPORTANT: If the credit card type is Switch or Solo, the value of
PAYMENTACTION must be Authorization and the CURRENCYCODE must be GBP. In addition, either STARTDATE or ISSUENUMBER must be specified.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Request.ACCT
member.summary:
Required: No.
Credit card number. Character length and limitations: numeric characters only. No spaces or punctutation.
Must conform with modulo and length required by each credit card type.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Request.EXPDATE
member.summary:
Required: No.
Credit card expiration date. Format: MMYYYY Character length and limitations: Six single-byte numeric characters, including leading zero.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Request.CVV2
member.summary:
Required: Your Merchant Account settings determine whether this field is required.
Card Verification Value, version 2. Character length for Visa, MasterCard, and Discover: exactly three digits.
Character length for American Express: exactly four digits. IMPORTANT: To comply with credit card processing regulations, once a
transaction has been completed, you must not store the value of CVV2.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.TRANSACTIONID
member.summary:
Unique transaction ID of the payment. NOTE: If the PaymentAction of the request was Authorization, the value of
TransactionID is your AuthorizationID for use with the Authorization and Capture APIs. Character length and limitations: 19 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.AMT
member.summary:
The final amount charged, including any shipping and taxes from your Merchant Profile. Character length and limitations: Does not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol.
Regardless of currency, decimal separator is a period (.), and the optional thousands separator is a comma (,). Equivalent to nine characters maximum for USD.
This value is the amount of the payment as specified by you on DoDirectPaymentRequest.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.FEEAMT
member.summary:
PayPal fee amount charged for the transaction. Character length and limitations: Does not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol.
Regardless of currency, decimal separator is a period (.), and the optional thousands separator is a comma (,). Equivalent to nine characters maximum for USD.
This value is the amount of the payment as specified by you on DoDirectPaymentRequest.

summary.para: Amount deposited in your PayPal account after a currency conversion.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.TAXAMT
member.summary:
Tax charged on the transaction. Character length and limitations: Does not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol.
Regardless of currency, decimal separator is a period (.), and the optional thousands separator is a comma (,). Equivalent to nine characters maximum for USD.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.EXCHANGERATE
member.summary:
Exchange rate if a currency conversion occurred. Relevant only if your are billing in their non-primary currency.
If the customer chooses to pay with a currency other than the nonprimary currency, the conversion occurs in the customer’s account.
Character length and limitations: a decimal that does not exceed 17 characters, including decimal point.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.PAYMENTTYPE
member.summary:
Indicates whether the payment is instant or delayed.
Character length and limitations: Seven single-byte characters. Possible values: none, echeck, or instant.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.PENDINGREASON
member.summary:
NOTE: PendingReason is returned in the response only if PaymentStatus is Pending.
The reason the payment is pending: none -- no pending reason.
address -- the payment is pending because your customer did not include a confirmed shipping address and your Payment Receiving Preferences is set such that you want
to manually accept or deny each of these payments. To change your preference, go to the Preferences section of your Profile.
echeck -- the payment is pending because it was made by an eCheck that has not yet cleared. intl -- the payment is pending because you hold a non-U.S. account and do not have a withdrawal
mechanism. You must manually accept or deny this payment from your Account Overview. multi-currency -- you do not have a balance in the currency sent, and you do not have
your Payment Receiving Preferences set to automatically convert and accept this payment. You must manually accept or deny this payment.
verify -- the payment is pending because you are not yet verified. You must verify your account before you can accept this payment.
other -- the payment is pending for a reason other than those listed above. For more information, contact PayPal Customer Service.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.REASONCODE
member.summary:
The reason for a reversal if TransactionType is reversal:
none -- no reason code. chargeback -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a chargeback by your customer.
guarantee -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to your customer triggering a money-back guarantee. buyer-complaint -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a complaint about the transaction from your customer.
refund -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction because you have given the customer a refund. other -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a reason not listed above.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.BILLINGAGREEMENTID
member.summary: The Billing agreement associated with this transaction. This field is returned only for express checkout reference transaction.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.ORDERTIME
member.summary:
The date of the transaction, in YYYY-MM-DD format.
NOTE: Undocumented.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.TRANSACTIONTYPE
member.summary:
The type of transaction.
Character length and limitations: 15 single-byte characters. Possible values: merchtpmt.
NOTE: Undocumented.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoReferenceTransaction.Response.AVSCODE
member.summary:

member.summary:
Parameter names for a DoExpressCheckoutPayment request.
Use these in the NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Add() function for convenience. Required parameters show first. The underscore on required parameters will not be included.
You must concatenate the number on numbered parameters, such as L_NAMEn.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Request._TOKEN
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
The timestamped token value that was returned by SetExpressCheckout response and passed on GetExpressCheckoutDetails request.
Character length and limitations: 20 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Request._PAYMENTACTION
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
How you want to obtain payment: Sale indicates that this is a final sale for which you are requesting payment.
Authorization indicates that this payment is a basic authorization subject to settlement with PayPal Authorization and Capture.
Order indicates that this payment is an order authorization subject to settlement with PayPal Authorization and Capture.
If the transaction does not include a one-time purchase, this field is ignored. NOTE: You cannot set this value to Sale in SetExpressCheckout request and then change
this value to Authorization or Order on the final API DoExpressCheckoutPayment request. If the value is set to Authorization or Order in SetExpressCheckout, the value may be set
to Sale or the same value (either Authorization or Order) in DoExpressCheckoutPayment. Character length and limit: Up to 13 single-byte alphabetic characters.
Default value: Sale

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Request._PAYERID
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Unique PayPal customer account identification number as returned by GetExpressCheckoutDetails response. Character length and limitations: 13 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Request._AMT
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Total of order, including shipping, handling, and tax. Limitations: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Request.DESC
member.summary:

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Request.CUSTOM

member.summary: Date and time of payment.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.AMT
member.summary: The final amount charged, including any shipping and taxes from your Merchant Profile.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.CURRENCYCODE
member.summary: A three-character currency code for the transaction.

member.summary: PayPal fee amount charged for the transaction.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.SETTLEAMT
member.summary: Amount deposited in your PayPal account after a currency conversion.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.TAXAMT
member.summary: Tax charged on the transaction.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.EXCHANGERATE
member.summary:
Exchange rate if a currency conversion occurred.
Relevant only if your are billing in their non-primary currency. If the customer chooses to pay with a currency other than the nonprimary
currency, the conversion occurs in the customer’s account.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.PAYMENTSTATUS
member.summary:
Status of the payment:
Completed -- the payment has been completed, and the funds have been added successfully to your account balance. Pending -- the payment is pending. See the PendingReason element for more information.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.PENDINGREASON
member.summary:
NOTE: PendingReason is returned in the response only if PaymentStatus is Pending.
The reason the payment is pending: none -- no pending reason.
address -- the payment is pending because your customer did not include a confirmed shipping address and your Payment Receiving Preferences is set such that you want
to manually accept or deny each of these payments. To change your preference, go to the Preferences section of your Profile.
echeck -- the payment is pending because it was made by an eCheck that has not yet cleared. intl -- the payment is pending because you hold a non-U.S. account and do not have a withdrawal
mechanism. You must manually accept or deny this payment from your Account Overview. multi-currency -- you do not have a balance in the currency sent, and you do not have
your Payment Receiving Preferences set to automatically convert and accept this payment. You must manually accept or deny this payment.
verify -- the payment is pending because you are not yet verified. You must verify your account before you can accept this payment.
other -- the payment is pending for a reason other than those listed above. For more information, contact PayPal Customer Service.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.REASONCODE
member.summary:
The reason for a reversal if TransactionType is reversal:
none -- no reason code. chargeback -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a chargeback by your customer.
guarantee -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to your customer triggering a money-back guarantee. buyer-complaint -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a complaint about the transaction from your customer.
refund -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction because you have given the customer a refund. other -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a reason not listed above.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoExpressCheckoutPayment.Response.REDIRECTREQUIRED
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether you need to redirect the customer to back to PayPal after completing the transaction. NOTE: Use this field only if you are using giropay or bank transfer payment methods in Germany.

member.summary:

The latest transaction date to be included in the search.

member.summary:

Search by the buyer’s email address. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.RECEIVER
member.summary:

Search by the receiver’s email address. If the merchant account has only one email, this is the primary email. Can also be a non-primary email.

member.summary:

member.summary:

Search by the transaction ID. The returned results are from the merchant’s transaction records.
Character length and limitations: 19 single-byte characters maximum.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.INVNUM
member.summary:
Required: No.
Search by invoice identification key, as set by you for the original transaction. This field searches the records for items sold by the merchant, not the items purchased.
NOTE: No wildcards are allowed. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte characters maximum.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.ACCT
member.summary:
Required: No.
Search by credit card number, as set by you for the original transaction. This field searches the records for items sold by the merchant, not the items purchased.
NOTE: No wildcards are allowed. Character length and limitations: Must be at least 11 and no more than 25 single-byte
numeric characters maximum. Special punctuation, such as dashes or spaces, is ignored.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.SALUTATION
member.summary:

Character length and limitations: 20 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.FIRSTNAME
member.summary:

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.SUFFIX

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.AUCTIONITEMNUMBER
member.summary:

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.TRANSACTIONCLASS
member.summary:
Required: No.
Search by classification of transaction. NOTE: Some kinds of possible classes of transactions are not searchable with this field.
You cannot search for bank transfer withdrawals, for example. All: all transaction classifications
Sent: only payments sent Received: only payments received
MassPay: only mass payments MoneyRequest: only money requests
FundsAdded: only funds added to balance FundsWithdrawn: only funds withdrawn from balance
Referral: only transactions involving referrals Fee: only transactions involving fees
Subscription: only transactions involving subscriptions Dividend: only transactions involving dividends
Billpay: only transactions involving BillPay Transactions Refund: only transactions involving funds
CurrencyConversions: only transactions involving currency conversions BalanceTransfer: only transactions involving balance transfers
Reversal: only transactions involving BillPay reversals Shipping: only transactions involving UPS shipping fees
BalanceAffecting: only transactions that affect the account balance ECheck: only transactions involving eCheck

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionSearch.Request.STATUS
member.summary:
Required: No.
Search by transaction status: Pending: The payment is pending. The specific reason the payment is pending is
returned by the GetTransactionDetails API PendingReason field. Processing: The payment is being processed.
Success: The payment has been completed and the funds have been added successfully to your account balance.
Denied: You denied the payment. This happens only if the payment was previously pending. Reversed: A payment was reversed due to a chargeback or other type of reversal.
The funds have been removed from your account balance and returned to the buyer.

Transaction amount.

member.name: T:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture
member.summary:
Create this object to make a DoCapture API call.
Minimum requirements -- add these name-value pairs and call Post(): AUTHORIZATIONID
AMT COMPLETETYPE

member.name: T:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Request
member.summary:
Parameter names for a DoCapture request.
Use these in the NvpDoCapture.Add() function for convenience. Required parameters show first. The underscore on required parameters will not be included.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Request._AUTHORIZATIONID
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
The authorization identification number of the payment you want to capture. This is the transaction id returned from DoExpressCheckoutPayment or DoDirectPayment.
Character length and limits: 19 single-byte characters maximum.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Request._AMT
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Amount to capture. Limitations: Value is a positive number which cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Request._COMPLETETYPE
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
The value Complete indicates that this the last capture you intend to make. The value NotComplete indicates that you intend to make additional captures.
NOTE: If Complete, any remaining amount of the original authorized transaction is automatically voided and all remaining open authorizations are voided.
Character length and limits: 12 single-byte alphanumeric characters

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Request.CURRENCYCODE
member.summary:
Required: No.
A three-character currency code.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Request.INVNUM
member.summary:
Required: No.
Your invoice number or other identification number that is displayed to the merchant and customer in his transaction history.
NOTE: This value on DoCapture will overwrite a value previously set on DoAuthorization. NOTE: The value is recorded only if the authorization you are capturing
is an order authorization, not a basic authorization. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Request.NOTE
member.summary:
Required: No.
An informational note about this settlement that is displayed to the payer in email and in his transaction history.
Character length and limits: 255 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Request.SOFTDESCRIPTOR
member.summary:
Required: No.
The soft descriptor is a per transaction description of the payment that is passed to the consumer’s credit card statement.
If a value for the soft descriptor field is provided, the full descriptor displayed on the customer’s statement has the following format:
[PP * | PAYPAL *][Merchant descriptor as set in the Payment Receiving Preferences][1 space][soft descriptor] The soft descriptor can contain only the following characters:
Alphanumeric characters - (dash) * (asterisk) . (period) {space} If you use any other characters (such as “,”), an error code is returned.
The soft descriptor does not include the phone number, which can be toggled between the merchant’s customer service number and PayPal’s customer service number.
The maximum length of the total soft descriptor is 22 characters. Of this, either 4 or 8 characters are used by the PayPal prefix shown in the data format.
Thus, the maximum length of the soft descriptor passed in the API request is: 22 - len([PP * | PAYPAL *]) - len([Descriptor set in Payment Receiving Preferences] + 1)
For example, assume the following conditions: The PayPal prefix toggle is set to PAYPAL * in PayPal’s admin tools.
The merchant descriptor set in the Payment Receiving Preferences is set to EBAY. The soft descriptor is passed in as JanesFlowerGifts LLC.
The resulting descriptor string on the credit card would be: PAYPAL *EBAY JanesFlow

member.summary:
Parameter names for a DoCapture response.
Use these in the NvpDoCapture.Get() function for convenience.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.AUTHORIZATIONID
member.summary:
The authorization identification number you specified in the request.
Character length and limits: 19 single-byte characters maximum.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.TRANSACTIONID
member.summary:
Unique transaction ID of the payment.
Character length and limits: 17 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.PARENTTRANSACTIONID
member.summary:
Original transaction to which this transaction is related.
This field is populated for the following transaction types: Reversal.
Capture of an authorized transaction. Reauthorization of a transaction.
Capture of an order -- the value of ParentTransactionID is the original OrderID. Authorization of an order -- the value of ParentTransactionID is the original OrderID.
Capture of an order authorization. Void of an order -- the value of ParentTransactionID is the original OrderID.
Character length and limitations: 19 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.RECEIPTID
member.summary:
Receipt ID.
Character length and limitations: 16 digits in xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx format.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.TRANSACTIONTYPE
member.summary:
The type of transaction:
cart or express-checkout Character length and limitations: 15 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.PAYMENTTYPE
member.summary:
Indicates whether the payment is instant or delayed.
Character length and limitations: Seven single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.ORDERTIME
member.summary: Date and time of payment.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.AMT
member.summary: The final amount charged, including any shipping and taxes from your Merchant Profile.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.CURRENCYCODE
member.summary: The currency for the transaction.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.FEEAMT
member.summary: PayPal fee amount charged for the transaction.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.SETTLEAMT
member.summary: Amount deposited into the account’s primary balance after a currency conversion

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.TAXAMT
member.summary: Amount of tax for transaction.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.EXCHANGERATE
member.summary:
Exchange rate if a currency conversion occurred.
Relevant only if you are billing in the customer’s non-primary currency. If the customer chooses to pay with a currency other than the non-primary currency,
the conversion occurs in the customer’s account. Character length and limitations: a decimal multiplier

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.PAYMENTSTATUS
member.summary:
The status of the payment:
None -- no status. Canceled-Reversal -- this means a reversal has been canceled.
For example,you won a dispute with the customer, and the funds for the transaction that was reversed have been returned to you.
Completed -- the payment has been completed, and the funds have been added successfully to your account balance.
Denied -- you denied the payment. This happens only if the payment was previously pending because of possible reasons described for the PendingReason element.
Expired -- the authorization period for this payment has been reached. Failed -- the payment has failed. This happens only if the payment was made
from your customer’s bank account. Pending -- the payment is pending. See the PendingReason field for more information.
Refunded -- you refunded the payment. Reversed -- a payment was reversed due to a chargeback or other type of reversal.
The funds have been removed from your account balance and returned to the buyer. The reason for the reversal is specified in the ReasonCode element.
Processed -- a payment has been accepted. Voided -- an authorization for this transaction has been voided.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.PENDINGREASON
member.summary:
NOTE: PendingReason is returned in the response only if PaymentStatus is Pending.
The reason the payment is pending: none -- no pending reason.
address -- the payment is pending because your customer did not include a confirmed shipping address and your Payment Receiving Preferences is set such that you want
to manually accept or deny each of these payments. To change your preference, go to the Preferences section of your Profile.
echeck -- the payment is pending because it was made by an eCheck that has not yet cleared. intl -- the payment is pending because you hold a non-U.S. account and do not have a withdrawal
mechanism. You must manually accept or deny this payment from your Account Overview. multi-currency -- you do not have a balance in the currency sent, and you do not have
your Payment Receiving Preferences set to automatically convert and accept this payment. You must manually accept or deny this payment.
verify -- the payment is pending because you are not yet verified. You must verify your account before you can accept this payment.
other -- the payment is pending for a reason other than those listed above. For more information, contact PayPal Customer Service.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoCapture.Response.REASONCODE
member.summary:
The reason for a reversal if TransactionType is reversal:
none -- no reason code. chargeback -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a chargeback by your customer.
guarantee -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to your customer triggering a money-back guarantee. buyer-complaint -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a complaint about the transaction from your customer.
refund -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction because you have given the customer a refund. other -- a reversal has occurred on this transaction due to a reason not listed above.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.Configuration.Password
member.summary:

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.Configuration.Signature
member.summary:

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.Configuration.Subject
member.summary:

third-party to make any particular PayPal API request.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.Configuration.KeyPassword
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if not using signature.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.Configuration.Certificate
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if not using signature.
Gets or Sets the path to the API login certificate. This is the file path from the application root,
for example: ~/Certificate/paypal_cert.p12 For WinForm applications, this must be the fully qualified path.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.Configuration.PayPalURL

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpMassPay.Request._RECEIVERTYPE
member.summary:

Indicates how you identify the recipients of payments in all the individual mass payment items: EmailAddress (L_EMAILn in the individual item)

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpMassPay.Request._L_AMTn
member.summary:

Payment amount. These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_AMT0, L_AMT1).

member.summary:
Required: Yes.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpMassPay.Request._L_EMAILn
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if RECEIVERTYPE = EmailAddress.
Email address of recipient. NOTE: You must specify either L_EMAILn or L_RECEIVERIDn, but you can not mix them.
Use only one or the other, but not both, in a single request. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte characters maximum.
These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_EMAIL0, L_EMAIL1).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpMassPay.Request._L_RECEIVERIDn
member.summary:

Unique PayPal customer account number. This value corresponds to the value of PAYERID returned by GetTransactionDetails.
NOTE: You must specify either L_EMAILn or L_RECEIVERIDn, but you can not mix them. Use only one or the other, but not both, in a single request.
These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_RECEIVERID0, L_RECEIVER1).

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpGetExpressCheckoutDetails.Response.AMT
member.summary: Total of order, including shipping, handling, and tax.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpGetExpressCheckoutDetails.Response.ITEMAMT
member.summary:
Sum of cost of all items in this order. Limitations: The value must be a positive number and cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
NOTE: ITEMAMT is required if you specify L_AMTn.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpGetExpressCheckoutDetails.Response.SHIPPINGAMT
member.summary:
Total shipping costs for this order. Limitations: The value must be zero or greater and cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
NOTE: If you specify a value for SHIPPINGAMT, you must also specify a value for ITEMAMT.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpGetExpressCheckoutDetails.Response.SHIPDISCAMT
member.summary:
Shipping discount for this order, specified as a negative number. Limitations: The value must be zero or greater and cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
NOTE: If you specify a value for SHIPPINGAMT, you must also specify a value for ITEMAMT.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpGetExpressCheckoutDetails.Response.INSURANCEAMT
member.summary:
Total shipping insurance costs for this order. Limitations: The value must be zero or greater and cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpGetExpressCheckoutDetails.Response.HANDLINGAMT
member.summary:
Total handling costs for this order. Limitations: The value must be zero or greater and cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
NOTE: If you specify a value for HANDLINGAMT, you must specify a value for ITEMAMT.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpGetExpressCheckoutDetails.Response.TAXAMT
member.summary:
Sum of tax for all items in this order. Limitations: The value must be zero or greater and cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
NOTE: TAXAMT is required if you specify L_TAXAMTn

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpGetExpressCheckoutDetails.Response.ADJUSTMENT
member.summary:
A discount or gift certificate offered by PayPal to the buyer.
This amount will be represented by a negative amount. If the buyer has a negative PayPal account balance, PayPal adds the negative
balance to the transaction amount, which is represented as a positive value.

member.summary:

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpBillOutstandingAmount.Request.AMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
The amount to bill. The amount must be less than or equal to the current outstanding balance of the profile.
If no value is specified, PayPal will attempt to bill the entire outstanding balance amount. Character length and limitations: Does not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Regardless of currency, decimal separator is a period (.), and the optional thousands separator is a comma (,).
Equivalent to nine characters maximum for USD.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpBillOutstandingAmount.Request._NOTE
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
The reason for the non-scheduled payment. For profiles created using Express Checkout,
this message will be included in the email notification to the buyer for the non-scheduled payment transaction,
and can also be seen by both you and the buyer on the Status History page of the PayPal account.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Create this object to make a DoNonReferencedCredit API call.
Minimum requirements -- add these name-value pairs and call Post(): AMT
CURRENCYCODE CREDITCARDTYPE
ACCT EXPDATE

member.name: T:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request
member.summary:
Parameter names for a DoNonReferencedCredit request.
Use these in the NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Add() function for convenience. Required parameters show first. The underscore on required parameters will not be included.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request._AMT
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Total of order, including shipping, handling, and tax. Limitations: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol.
Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
AMT = NETAMT + SHIPPINGAMT + TAXAMT

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request.NETAMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
Total amount of all items in this transaction. Limitations: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol.
Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request.SHIPPINGAMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
Total shipping costs in this transaction. Limitations: The value must be zero or greater and cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request.TAXAMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
Sum of tax for all items in this order. Limitations: The value must be zero or greater and cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request._CURRENCYCODE
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Currency code. Default: USD. The only valid currencies are AUD, CAD, EUR, GBP, JPY, and USD.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request._CREDITCARDTYPE
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Type of credit card. Character length and limitations: Up to ten single-byte alphabetic characters.
Allowable values: Visa, MasterCard, Discover, Amex, Switch, or Solo. IMPORTANT: If the credit card type is Switch or Solo, the value of
PAYMENTACTION must be Authorization and the CURRENCYCODE must be GBP. In addition, either STARTDATE or ISSUENUMBER must be specified.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request._ACCT
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Credit card number. Character length and limitations: numeric characters only. No spaces or punctutation.
Must conform with modulo and length required by each credit card type.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request._EXPDATE
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Credit card expiration date. Format: MMYYYY Character length and limitations: Six single-byte numeric characters, including leading zero.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoNonReferencedCredit.Request._CVV2
member.summary:
Required: Your Merchant Account settings determine whether this field is required.
Card Verification Value, version 2. Character length for Visa, MasterCard, and Discover: exactly three digits.
Character length for American Express: exactly four digits. IMPORTANT: To comply with credit card processing regulations, once a
transaction has been completed, you must not store the value of CVV2.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoDirectPayment.Request.SOFTDESCRIPTOR
member.summary:
Required: No.
The soft descriptor is a per transaction description of the payment that is passed to the consumer’s credit card statement.
If a value for the soft descriptor field is provided, the full descriptor displayed on the customer’s statement has the following format:
[PP * | PAYPAL *][Merchant descriptor as set in the Payment Receiving Preferences][1 space][soft descriptor] The soft descriptor can contain only the following characters:
Alphanumeric characters - (dash) * (asterisk) . (period) {space} If you use any other characters (such as “,”), an error code is returned.
The soft descriptor does not include the phone number, which can be toggled between the merchant’s customer service number and PayPal’s customer service number.
The maximum length of the total soft descriptor is 22 characters. Of this, either 4 or 8 characters are used by the PayPal prefix shown in the data format.
Thus, the maximum length of the soft descriptor passed in the API request is: 22 - len([PP * | PAYPAL *]) - len([Descriptor set in Payment Receiving Preferences] + 1)
For example, assume the following conditions: The PayPal prefix toggle is set to PAYPAL * in PayPal’s admin tools.
The merchant descriptor set in the Payment Receiving Preferences is set to EBAY. The soft descriptor is passed in as JanesFlowerGifts LLC.
The resulting descriptor string on the credit card would be: PAYPAL *EBAY JanesFlow

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpDoDirectPayment.Request.CVV2
member.summary:
Required: Your Merchant Account settings determine whether this field is required.
Card Verification Value, version 2. Character length for Visa, MasterCard, and Discover: exactly three digits.
Character length for American Express: exactly four digits. IMPORTANT: To comply with credit card processing regulations, once a
transaction has been completed, you must not store the value of CVV2.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.Delegate
member.summary:
Required: No.
Gets or Sets a delegate that returns a NvpCredentials object. If you have a function that returns a NvpCredentials object,
set this property to that function name to automatically set the credentials for this API call.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.Username
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Gets or Sets the API username, which is auto-generated by PayPal when applying for a digital certificate to use the PayPal API.
If not set, looks for "username" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.Password
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Gets or Sets the API password, which was specified when applying for a digital certificate to use the PayPal NVP API.
If not set, looks for "password" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.Signature
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if not using certificate.
Gets or Sets the API signature, if used instead of an API Certificate. If not set, looks for "signature" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.Subject
member.summary:
Required: No.
Gets or Sets the email address of a third-party for whom requests are sent to the PayPal NVP API. The API username must have been granted permission by this
third-party to make any particular PayPal API request. If not set, looks for "subject" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.UseEncryption
member.summary:
Required: No.
Gets or Sets the API encryption status. If true, class library will assume the Username, Password, Signature, KeyPassword and Subject values
are encrypted and attempt to decrypt them using the "EncryptionKey" value. If not set, looks for "useCertificate" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.
Default: false

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if using credential encryption.
Gets or Sets the encryption key value for encrypted API credentials. If not set, looks for "encryptionKey" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.UseCertificate
member.summary:
Required: No. Gets or Sets the Certificate status. If true, API call will
use the certificate supplied in the Certificate property. If not set, looks for "useCertificate" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section. Default: false

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.Certificate
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if UseCertificate is true.
Gets or Sets the path to the API login certificate. This is the file path from the application root,
for example: ~/Certificate/paypal_cert.p12 If not set, looks for "certificate" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCredentials.KeyPassword
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if UseCertificate is true.
Gets or Sets the API certificate encryption password. If not set, looks for "keyPassword" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.

Void of an order Character length and limitations: 19 single-byte characters.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.PaymentDate
member.summary: Gets the date and time of payment.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.PaymentStatus
member.summary:
Gets the status of the payment:
None: No status Canceled-Reversal: This means a reversal has been canceled. For
example, you won a dispute with the customer, and the funds for the transaction that was reversed have been returned to you.
Completed: The payment has been completed, and the funds have been added successfully to your account balance.
Denied: You denied the payment. This happens only if the payment was previously pending because of possible reasons described for
the PendingReason element. Expired: the authorization period for this payment has been reached.
Failed: The payment has failed. This happens only if the payment was made from your customer’s bank account.
Pending: The payment is pending. See the PendingReason field for more information.
Refunded: You refunded the payment. Reversed: A payment was reversed due to a chargeback or other
type of reversal. The funds have been removed from your account balance and returned to the buyer. The reason for the reversal
is specified in the ReasonCode element. Processed: A payment has been accepted.
Voided: An authorization for this transaction has been voided.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.PaymentType
member.summary:
Gets the payment type, indicating whether the payment is instant or delayed.
Character length and limitations: Seven single-byte characters.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.PendingReason
member.summary:
Gets the reason the payment is pending:
none: No pending reason address: The payment is pending because your customer did not
include a confirmed shipping address and your Payment Receiving Preferences is set such that you want to manually
accept or deny each of these payments. echeck: The payment is pending because it was made by an eCheck
that has not yet cleared. intl: The payment is pending because you hold a non-U.S.
account and do not have a withdrawal mechanism. You must manually accept or deny this payment from your Account Overview.
multi-currency: You do not have a balance in the currency sent, and you do not have your Payment Receiving Preferences set to
automatically convert and accept this payment. You must manually accept or deny this payment.
verify: The payment is pending because you are not yet verified. You must verify your account before you can accept this payment.
other: The payment is pending for a reason other than those listed above.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.ReasonCode
member.summary:
Gets the reason for a reversal if TransactionType is reversal:
none: No reason code chargeback: A reversal has occurred on this transaction due to
a chargeback by your customer. guarantee: A reversal has occurred on this transaction due to
your customer triggering a money-back guarantee. buyer-complaint: A reversal has occurred on this transaction due
to a complaint about the transaction from your customer. other: A reversal has occurred on this transaction due to
a reason not listed above.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.ReceiptID
member.summary:
Gets the Receipt ID
Character length and limitations: 16 digits in xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx format.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.SettleAmount
member.summary:
Gets the amount deposited into the account’s primary
balance after a currency conversion from automatic conversion through your Payment Receiving Preferences
or manual conversion through manually accepting a payment. This amount is calculated after fees and taxes have been assessed.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.TaxAmount
member.summary: Gets the amount of tax for transaction.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.TransactionID
member.summary:
Gets the PayPal transaction identification number.
Character length and limitations: 19 single-byte characters.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.TransactionType
member.summary:
Gets the type of transaction
cart: Transaction created by customer via the PayPal Shopping Cart feature. send-money: Transaction created by customer from the Send Money tab on the PayPal website.
web-accept: Transaction created by customer via Buy Now, Donation, or Auction Smart Logos. subscr-*: Transaction created by customer via Subscription. eot means “end of subscription term.”
merch-pmt: preapproved payment. virtual-terminal: Transaction created via merchant virtual terminal.

member.summary: Gets the counter used for multi-item auction payments

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.EffectiveDate
member.summary: Gets the date when the subscription modification will be effective.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.Password
member.summary:
Gets the Password generated by PayPal and given to
subscriber to access the subscription. For security, the value of the password is hashed.
Character length and limitations: 128 alphanumeric single-byte characters.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.Reattempt

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.Recurrences
member.summary:
Gets the number of payment installments that will occur at the regular rate.
Character length and limitations: no limit.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.Recurring
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether regular rate recurs.

member.summary: Gets the subscription start date.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.SubscriptionID
member.summary:
Gets the ID generated by PayPal for the subscriber.
Character length and limitations: no limit.

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpTransactionDetails.UserName
member.summary:
Gets the username generated by PayPal and given to
subscriber to access the subscription. Character length and limitations: 64 alphanumeric single-byte characters.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpMpItem.ReceiverID
member.summary:

Unique PayPal customer account number. This value corresponds to the value of PAYERID returned by GetTransactionDetails.
NOTE: You must specify either Email or ReceiverID, but you can not mix them. Use only one or the other, but not both, in a single request.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpCommonResponse.ACK
member.summary:
Gets a token representing the application-level acknowledgement code.
Contains one of the following enumerated values: Success: Request processing succeeded
Failure: Request processing failed SuccessWithWarning: Request processing completed successfully
but with some warning information in Errors that could be useful for the requesting application to process or record.
FailureWithWarning: Request processing failed with some error and warning information that the requesting application should process
to determine causes of failure. CustomCode: Reserved for internal or future use.

Item description. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpLineItemRequest.L_QTYn
member.summary:

Item quantity. Character length and limitations: Any positive integer.
These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_QTY0, L_QTY1).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpLineItemRequest.L_AMTn
member.summary:
Required: No.
Cost of item. Limitations: Value can be positive, negative or zero and must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_AMT0, L_AMT1). NOTE: If you specify a value for L_AMTn, you must specify a value for ITEMAMT.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpLineItemRequest.L_TAXAMTn
member.summary:
Required: No.
Item sales tax. Limitations: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency.
No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_TAXAMT0, L_TAXAMT1).

member.name: T:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement
member.summary:
Create this object to make a SetCustomerBillingAgreement API call.
Minimum requirements -- add these name-value pairs and call Post(): BILLINGTYPE
RETURNURL CANCELURL

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.PayPalUrl
member.summary:
Required: Yes, for ExpressCheckout based API calls
Gets or Sets the base URL for redirecting the payer to PayPal. If not set, looks for "paypalURL" value in Web.Config encore.PayPal.NVP section.
Default: https://www.paypal.com/

member.name: P:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.RedirectUrl
member.summary: Gets the URL to which you redirect the user to log into PayPal and accept the transaction.

member.name: T:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request
member.summary:
Parameter names for a SetCustomerBillingAgreement request.
Use these in the NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Add() function for convenience. Required parameters show first. The underscore on required parameters will not be included.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request._BILLINGTYPE
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Type of billing agreement. For reference transactions, this field must be MerchantInitiatedBilling, which requests
PayPal to prompt the buyer to set up a billing agreement for recurring payments. For recurring payments, the value must be RecurringPayments.
NOTE: Other defined values are not valid.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.BILLINGAGREEMENTDESCRIPTION
member.summary:
Required: No.
Description of goods or services associated with the billing agreement.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.BILLINGAGREEMENTCUSTOM
member.summary:
Required: No.
Custom annotation field for your own use. NOTE: This field is ignored for recurring payments.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.PAYMENTTYPE
member.summary:
Required: No.
Specifies type of PayPal payment you require for the billing agreement, which is one of the following values: Any or InstantOnly
NOTE: This field is ignored for recurring payments.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request._RETURNURL
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
URL to which the customer’s browser is returned after choosing to pay with PayPal. NOTE: PayPal recommends that the value be the final review page on which
the customer confirms the order and payment or billing agreement. Character length and limitations: no limit.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request._CANCELURL
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
URL to which the customer is returned if he does not approve the use of PayPal to pay you. NOTE: PayPal recommends that the value be the original page on which
the customer chose to pay with PayPal or establish a billing agreement. Character length and limitations: no limit.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.LOCALECODE
member.summary:
Required: No.
Locale of pages displayed by PayPal during Express Checkout. Character length and limitations: Any two-character country code.
The following two-character country codes are supported by PayPal: AU, DE, FR, IT, GB, ES, or US
Any other value will default to US.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.PAGESTYLE
member.summary:
Required: No.
Sets the Custom Payment Page Style for payment pages associated with this button/link. This value corresponds to the HTML variable page_style for customizing payment pages.
The value is the same as the Page Style Name you chose when adding or editing the page style from the Profile subtab of the My Account tab of your PayPal account.
Character length and limitations: 30 single-byte alphabetic characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.HDRIMG
member.summary:
Required: No.
URL for the image you want to appear at the top left of the payment page. The image has a maximum size of 750 pixels wide by 90 pixels high.
PayPal recommends that you provide an image that is stored on a secure (https) server. If you do not specify an image, the business name is displayed.
Character length and limit: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.HDRBORDERCOLOR
member.summary:
Required: No.
Sets the border color around the header of the payment page. The border is a 2-pixel perimeter around the header space, which is 750 pixels wide by 90 pixels high.
By default, the color is black. Character length and limitations: Six character HTML hexadecimal color code in ASCII.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.HDRBACKCOLOR
member.summary:
Required: No.
Sets the background color for the header of the payment page. By default, the color is white.
Character length and limitations: Six character HTML hexadecimal color code in ASCII.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.PAYFLOWCOLOR
member.summary:
Required: No.
Sets the background color for the payment page. By default, the color is white.
Character length and limitations: Six character HTML hexadecimal color code in ASCII.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpSetCustomerBillingAgreement.Request.EMAIL
member.summary:
Required: No.
Email address of the buyer as entered during checkout. PayPal uses this value to pre-fill the PayPal membership sign-up portion of the PayPal login page.
Character length and limit: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

member.summary:
Create this object to make a UpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile API call.
Minimum requirements -- add these name-value pairs and call Post(): PROFILEID
NOTE

member.name: T:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request
member.summary:
Parameter names for a UpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile request.
Use these in the NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Add() function for convenience. Required parameters show first. The underscore on required parameters will not be included.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request._PROFILEID
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
Recurring payments profile ID returned in the CreateRecurringPaymentsProfile response.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request._NOTE
member.summary:
Required: Yes.
The reason for the update to the recurring payments profile. This message will be included in the email notification to the buyer
for the recurring payments profile update. This note can be seen by you on the Status History page of the PayPal account. For recurring
payments profiles created using Express Checkout, the buyer can also see the note from their PayPal account.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.DESC
member.summary:
Required: No.
Description of the recurring payment. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SUBSCRIBERNAME
member.summary:
Required: No.
Full name of the person receiving the product or service paid for by the recurring payment. If not present, the name in the buyer’s PayPal account is used.
Character length and limitations: 32 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPTONAME
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if Shipping Address is specified.
Person’s name associated with this address. Character length and limitations: 32 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPTOSTREET
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if Ship to Address is specified.
First street address. Character length and limitations: 100 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPTOCITY
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if Ship to Address is specified.
Name of city. Character length and limitations: 40 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPTOSTATE
member.summary:
Required: Yes, for U.S. addresses if Ship to Address is specified.
State or province. Character length and limitations: 40 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPTOZIP
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if Ship to Address is specified.
U.S. ZIP code or other country-specific postal code. Character length and limitations: 20 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPTOCOUNTRYCODE
member.summary:
Required: Yes, if Ship to Address is specified.
Country code. Character limit: Two single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPTOSTREET2
member.summary:
Required: No.
Second street address. Character length and limitations: 100 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPTOPHONENUM
member.summary:
Required: No.
Phone number. Character length and limit: 20 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.PROFILEREFERENCE
member.summary:
Required: No.
The merchant’s own unique reference or invoice number. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.ADDITIONALBILLINGCYCLES
member.summary:
Required: No.
The number of additional billing cycles to add to this profile.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.AMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
Billing amount for each cycle in the subscription period, not including shipping and tax amounts.
NOTE: For recurring payments with Express Checkout, the payment amount can be increased by no more than 20% every 180 days (starting when the profile is created).
Limitations: Value must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.),
and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.CURRENCYCODE
member.summary:
Required: No.
A 3-character currency code.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.SHIPPINGAMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
Shipping amount for each billing cycle during the regular payment period. NOTE: All amounts in the request must have the same currency.
Limitations: The value cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.),
and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.TAXAMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
Tax amount for each billing cycle during the regular payment period. NOTE: All amounts in the request must have the same currency.
Limitations: The value cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.),
and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.OUTSTANDINGAMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
The current past due or outstanding amount for this profile. You can only decrease the outstanding amount—it cannot be increased.
Limitations: The value cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.),
and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.AUTOBILLOUTAMT
member.summary:
Required: No.
This field indicates whether you would like PayPal to automatically bill the outstanding balance amount in the next billing cycle.
The outstanding balance is the total amount of any previously failed payments. Valid values: Must be NoAutoBill or AddToNextBilling

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.MAXFAILEDPAYMENTS
member.summary:
Required: No.
The number of scheduled payments that can fail before the profile is automatically suspended. Character length and limitations: Number string representing an integer.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.CREDITCARDTYPE
member.summary:
Required: No.
Type of credit card. Character length and limitations: Up to ten single-byte alphabetic characters.
Allowable values: Visa, MasterCard, Discover, Amex, Switch, or Solo.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.EXPDATE
member.summary:
Required: No.
Credit card expiration date. Format: MMYYYY Character length and limitations: Six single-byte numeric characters, including leading zero.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.CVV2
member.summary:
Required: Your Merchant Account settings determine whether this field is required.
Card Verification Value, version 2. Character length for Visa, MasterCard, and Discover: exactly three digits.
Character length for American Express: exactly four digits. IMPORTANT: To comply with credit card processing regulations, once a
transaction has been completed, you must not store the value of CVV2.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.ISSUEDATE
member.summary:
Required: No.
Month and year that Switch or Solo card was issued. Format: MMYYYY Character length and limitations: Six single-byte numeric characters, including leading zero.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.ISSUENUMBER
member.summary:
Required: No.
Issue number of Switch or Solo card. Character length: two numeric digits maximum.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.FIRSTNAME
member.summary:
Required: No.
Payer’s first name. Character length and limitations: 25 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.LASTNAME
member.summary:
Required: No.
Payer’s last name. Character length and limitations: 25 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.EMAIL
member.summary:
Required: No.
Payer's email address.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.STREET
member.summary:
Required: No.
First street address. Character length and limitations: 100 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.STREET2
member.summary:
Required: No.
Second street address. Character length and limitations: 100 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.CITY
member.summary:
Required: No.
Name of city. Character length and limitations: 40 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.STATE
member.summary:
Required: No.
State or province. Character length and limitations: 40 single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.COUNTRY
member.summary:
Required: No.
Country code. Character length and limitations: Two single-byte characters.

member.name: F:Encore.PayPal.Nvp.NvpUpdateRecurringPaymentsProfile.Request.ZIP
